title: How to Make Clay for Kids

steps.title: Gather the ingredients.
steps.content: Gather the ingredients. You'll need: 1 cup salt 2 cups flour 2 tablespoons cream of tartar 2 tablespoons vegetable oil Food coloring, optional 2 cups boiling water

steps.title: Mix the dry ingredients.
steps.content: Mix the dry ingredients. Stir together the salt, flour, and cream of tartar in a large bowl until they're well mixed.

steps.title: Add the oil and food coloring, if using.
steps.content: Add the oil and food coloring, if using. Make a well in the middle of your dry ingredients and pour the oil and food color in the center.

steps.title: Pour in the boiling water.
steps.content: Pour in the boiling water. Pour the water over all the ingredients in your bowl and stir the mixture well. You may not need to put all the water in. Use caution when heating the water and pouring the boiling liquid.

steps.title: Let the clay rest for a few minutes.
steps.content: Let the clay rest for a few minutes. This will allow the flour to absorb some of the water and let the clay set up.

steps.title: Knead the flour until smooth.
steps.content: Knead the flour until smooth. Remove the clay from the bowl and form it into a ball. Knead it for a few minutes until the clay is smooth.

steps.title: Store in an airtight container.
steps.content: Store in an airtight container. If you store dyed clay in a plastic container, be aware that the clay may stain. The dough should keep for a few weeks, if sealed well. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Gather the ingredients.
steps.content: Gather the ingredients. You'll need: 5 cups water 2 1/2 cups salt 3 tablespoons cream of tartar food coloring, optional 10 tablespoons vegetable oil 5 cups flour

steps.title: Combine water, salt, cream of tartar, and food coloring, if using.
steps.content: Combine water, salt, cream of tartar, and food coloring, if using. Place them in a large saucepan and stir till well combined.

steps.title: Cook the mixture.
steps.content: Cook the mixture. Stir the mixture constantly over medium-low heat until the mixture is hot. Then, stir in the vegetable oil.

steps.title: Gradually add the flour.
steps.content: Gradually add the flour. Add one cup of flour at a time and stir really well after each cup you add. The mixture will be sticky and shaggy. Just keep stirring.

steps.title: Keep stirring till clay forms.
steps.content: Keep stirring till clay forms. The dough will start pulling away from the side of the pan. Turn off the heat and scoop the clay onto a dry surface.

steps.title: Let the clay cool.
steps.content: Let the clay cool. Once the clay is cool enough to handle, knead the clay until it's smooth. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Store in an airtight container.Cooked clay can keep for several months, if well sealed.
steps.content: Store in an airtight container.Cooked clay can keep for several months, if well sealed. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Gather the ingredients.
steps.content: Gather the ingredients. You'll need: 1 cup cornstarch 2 cups baking soda 1 1/4 cups water 1 tablespoon vegetable oil food coloring, optional

steps.title: Combine the cornstarch and baking soda.
steps.content: Combine the cornstarch and baking soda. Stir them together in a saucepan.

steps.title: Add the water, vegetable, and food coloring, if using.
steps.content: Add the water, vegetable, and food coloring, if using. Stir until the mixture is thoroughly combined and smooth.

steps.title: Cook the mixture.
steps.content: Cook the mixture. Place the saucepan over medium heat and cook until the mixture starts to look a bit dry. Stir constantly to keep the mixture from sticking. When the mixture starts to look like dry mashed potatoes, it's finished cooking.

steps.title: Scoop the clay onto a plate to cool.
steps.content: Scoop the clay onto a plate to cool. Once the clay has clumped together in the saucepan, remove it from heat and transfer it to a plate.

steps.title: Let the clay cool.
steps.content: Let the clay cool. Once the clay is cool enough to handle, knead the clay until it's smooth. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Store in an airtight container.Cooked clay can keep for several months, if well sealed.
steps.content: Store in an airtight container.Cooked clay can keep for several months, if well sealed. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Gather the ingredients.
steps.content: Gather the ingredients. You'll need: 2 slices white bread 4 tablespoons white glue Paint for coloring, optional.

steps.title: Remove the crusts.
steps.content: Remove the crusts. Cut or tear off the crusts from the bread and throw the crusts away.

steps.title: Tear the bread into small pieces.
steps.content: Tear the bread into small pieces. Smaller pieces of bread will make kneading the clay easier. Place your bread pieces in a small bowl.

steps.title: Add the glue.
steps.content: Add the glue. Mix the bread and glue together thoroughly with a large spoon.

steps.title: Add food coloring, optional.
steps.content: Add food coloring, optional. Add a couple of drops and stir well. Always add small amounts until you get the desired color.

steps.title: Put a glove on one hand.
steps.content: Put a glove on one hand. The glove will keep your hand clean and dry.

steps.title: Transfer clay to a bowl.
steps.content: Transfer clay to a bowl. When the bread clay starts to form into a mass, remove it from the bowl. Knead it with the gloved hand until it stops being sticky.

steps.title: Remove the glove.
steps.content: Remove the glove. Knead the clay ball with both hands. When it forms a ball, it's ready for using in your project.

steps.title: Store in an airtight container.
steps.content: Store in an airtight container. Clay can keep for a few weeks, if well sealed and kept in the refrigerator.

steps.title: Gather the ingredients.
steps.content: Gather the ingredients. You'll need: 2 cups flour 1 cup salt 2 packages unsweetened Kool-Aid 2 cups boiling water 1 tablespoon vegetable oil

steps.title: Combine flour, salt, and Kool-Aid powder.
steps.content: Combine flour, salt, and Kool-Aid powder. Stir the ingredients in a large bowl.

steps.title: Mix boiling water and vegetable oil.
steps.content: Mix boiling water and vegetable oil. In a separate bowl, stir together the boiling water and vegetable oil until mostly combined. Use caution when heating and pouring boiling water.

steps.title: Stir the water mixture into the dry mixture.
steps.content: Stir the water mixture into the dry mixture. Mix the dry and wet ingredients till completely combined and smooth.

steps.title: Let the clay cool.
steps.content: Let the clay cool. When the clay has cooled to the touch, remove it from the bowl and knead until it's totally smooth.

steps.title: Store in an airtight container.
steps.content: Store in an airtight container. If you store dyed clay in a plastic container, be aware that the clay may stain. The dough should keep for a few weeks, if sealed well.
